column4: Guys, i have never compiled a program before, i downloaded a tar.bz2 file, unpacked it, did ./configure and then make... is that all? =) Lol... im a damn n00b
cry

thats about it. i usually have /home/myusername/local directory so i do ./configure --prefix=/home/username/local;make;make install just to test it before actually installing to /usr/local/ or wherever
thanx man
just did make on wine, and it takes FOREVER... is does "make" take a long time? =) lol
ubuntu usually has very new version of wine you shouldnt have to install. wine has an ubuntu repo too you can add to sources.list
er shouldnt have to compile i mean

i know.. hehe.. i got it in my sources.list and i did the apt-get install .. but wine just didnt work on my ubuntu 6.10... the newest version of wine at least.. so i thought i should try to compile it =)
you often need to run winecfg and set a few things up.  its a gui tool
yepp, i did run winecfg but i got this error when trying to save changes http://pastebin.ca/362243
and when trying to install dreamweaver 8 i got this error http://pastebin.ca/362233
well the first error can be fixed probably by doing: sudo chown -R ~/.wine   i dont know about the second
er sudo chown -R Meltdown79 ~/.wine
im no wine expert but i normally just wine installer.exe  from anywhere
me too... hmm....
is it configured for win2k or 98?
i did winecfg and chose Windows XP and then pressed OK =)
bah  rm -fr ~/.wine and rerun config maybe
when removing .wine dir and doing winecfg it creats .wine dir..but i get this message "Failed to open the service control manager." any idea?
might /j wine   i really dont have alot of experience with it other than basic stuff
kk thanx man
